#### Setup 
```{r}
pacman::p_load("tidyverse", "here", "janitor", "ggthemes")
```

Read that data
```{r}
toolik_biochem <- read.csv(here::here("data", "2011_Kling_Akchem.csv"), na = c(".", "NA")) %>% clean_names()

inlet_biochem <- toolik_biochem %>% 
  filter(site == "Toolik Inlet")

inlet_biochem <- inlet_biochem %>% 
  select (p_h, doc_u_m , tdn_u_m)
```

Now we find the mean 

1st as a for loop
```{r}
for (i in 1:ncol(inlet_biochem)) {
 Sheeesh <-  mean(inlet_biochem[[i]], na.rm = TRUE)
 print(Sheeesh)
}
```

ok now we need 2 different ways
apply first
```{r}
apply(X = inlet_biochem,
      MARGIN = 2,
      FUN = mean,
      na.rm = TRUE)
```

now with purr
```{r}
purrr::map_df(.x = inlet_biochem, .f = mean, na.rm = TRUE)
```

Nice BYE!!!
